p: In July 2017, severe cases of influenza A(H1N1)pdm09 were detected in Myanmar, and the MoHS declared a high alert to mitigate the influenza outbreaks in the country. The overall numbers of severe pneumonia cases and fatal cases reached 1198 and 38, respectively [ 9]. This 2017 outbreak had a significant impact on the society of Myanmar. Eventually, the outbreak was successfully controlled in October 2017 by implementing and strengthening active influenza surveillance through early and timely detection of cases and the distribution of clinical management guidelines at hospitals ( S1 File).
